subject: Re: setup question
msgSnippet: I tried what you said but got back another error. Typed: java -classpath %PATH% junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests Got back: Exception in thread
messageBody:
I tried what you said but got back another error.
Typed: java -classpath %PATH% junit.textui.TestRunner
junit.samples.AllTests

Got back: Exception in thread "main"
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
files\sdb\programs\bin;c:program

-- Aaron



--- junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> ------------------------ Yahoo! Groups Sponsor

> Message: 1
> Date: Sat, 14 Aug 2004 11:43:51 -0700 (PDT)
> From: "Aaron R. Short" <fuzzyfonzy@...>
> Subject: setup question
>
> I'm trying to install junit but something isn't
> right.
>
> I'm running on Windows XP with Java 1.4
>
> I've extracted junit3.8.1.zip to c:\Program Files
>
> Which gives me a directory c:\Program
> Files\junit3.8.1
>
> I've set the classpaths.
>
> When I check the environment variables path is set
> to:
>
C:\PROGRA~1\Borland\Delphi5\Projects\Bpl;C:\PROGRA~1\Borland\Delphi5\Bin;%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program
>
Files\Symantec\pcAnywhere\;C:\ant1.6.1\bin;C:\program
> files\jython;C:\program files\junit3.8.1;C:\program
> files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
>
> Notice the junit3.8.1 directory and the junit.jar
> are
> both on the class path.
>
> This seems to be everything the install tell one to
> do. However when I go the command prompt and type
> "java junit.textui.TestRunner
> junit.samples.AllTests"
> I get back the error "Exception in thread "main"
> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junit/textui/TestRunner"
>
> I've had this problem in the past with other jar
> files
> and it seems to be related to when they don't set
> the
> main class in the manifest file of the jar.
>
> I'm uncertain what to do to solve this. I'm sure
> it's
> something simple. Your help would be appreciated.
>
> -- Aaron
>
>

> Message: 2
> Date: Sun, 15 Aug 2004 08:47:10 -0400
> From: "Jason Rogers" <jacaetevha@...>
> Subject: Re: setup question
>
> Sounds like you have put them in your PATH variable,
> not your CLASSPATH.
>
> Invoking it like this should work: java -classpath
> %PATH%
> junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
>
> On Sat, 14 Aug 2004 11:43:51 -0700 (PDT), "Aaron R.
> Short"
